item.description:
We don't usually list walks outside of MSSF, but this one is too hard to resist. You'll love this beautiful park!

Ellisville Harbor State Park
Did you pile the mashed potatoes too high? Eat one too many slices of pumpkin pie? Did the gravy boat
overflow onto your plate? Come out for a briskly paced hike to burn off some of those turkey dinner calories! Please bring water and be prepared to cover 2 - 3 miles of moderate difficulty trails including walking along the sandy beach.

Meet at the dirt parking lot off Route 3A (between Davis Road and Ellisville Road) in Plymouth. Program is free and open to the public. For adults and older children who can walk at a moderate to fast pace. Rain cancels. For more information, call Amy at (508) 272-9376.

For park information & directions, visit
http://www.mass.gov/d....

This hike is sponsored by the MA Department of Conservation and Recreation and will be led by our favorite DCR Interpreter, Amy.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for Amy. She'll be wearing an official DCR shirt and hat.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Too Much Turkey Hike at Ellisville Harbor State Park!
